deck: Bob De Moor (1925-1992) was a Belgian comic book writer and artist.
description:
Bob De Moor was born in Belgium on December 20, 1925 as Robert Frans Marie De Moor. He started drawing at a very early age, sketching the ships in Antwerp harbor. After graduating from the Antwerp Academy Of Fine Arts, he started working at the Afim animations studios. After drawing several strips for various magazine in Flemish and releasing a French language album, he starts working for Kuifje, the Flemish version of Le Journal De Tintin in 1949 before joining the French edition as well that same year. The following year, at 25, he integrates the Studios HergÃ© and quickly becomes the legendary master's most trusted collaborator following Edgar Pierre Jacobs' departure. A master of the "ligne claire" style of drawing, he supervises all the ancillary drawings of Tintin, the animated films and works on the updated edition of L'Ãle Noire. A project to revive Les Aventures De Jo, Zette & Jocko by adapting a discarded Tintin story is never completed and following HergÃ©'s death he dreams of finishing the famous reporter's last incomplete adventure, Tintin Et L'Alph-Art but after much hesitation, HergÃ©'s widow declines. He did however complete Les 3 Formules Du Professeur SatÅ, the Blake Et Mortimer story left unfinished by Jacobs after his death. De Moor died in Brussels a couple of years after completing this work, on August 26, 1992. He was 66.

Although he is best remembered for his collaborations with other masters, which apart from HergÃ© and Jacobs include Jacques Martin and childhood friend Willy Vandersteen, he created a number of characters of his own, the most notable of which are Barelli and Cori Le Moussaillon. His son Johan followed in his father's footsteps and is a noted comic book artist himself.
name: Bob De Moor
Olivier Roman

deck: Ted Benoit is a French comic book writer and illustrator
description: Ted Benoit was born in France on July 25, 1947 as Thierry Benoit. He studies at the prestigious IDHEC cinema school in Paris and until 1971 works as an assistant director in television, which he abandons to work in comic books as an artist and in the eighties becomes known as an unparalleled master of the "ligne claire" style of drawing. His perfectionism makes him a very slow worker and as such he isn't very productive in the industry, but also very popular in press and advertisement.
name: Ted Benoit

deck: Herb "Chip" Wood is an artist who worked on the Adolescent Radioactive Black Belt Hamsters.
description: Chip Wood worked on three issues of ARBBH, including two back-up stories, one main story, and a pin-up.
name: Herb Wood

deck: Didier Convard is a French comic book writer, artist and colorist.
description: Didier Convard was born in France on January 16, 1950. After art school and four years in advertising, he starts working in the world of comic books in 1972 and quickly establishes a working partnership with AndrÃ© Juillard for the Isabelle Fantouri series. After art school and four years in advertising, he starts working in the world of comic books in 1972 and quickly establishes a working partnership with AndrÃ© Juillard.. During the late eighties he starts concentrating more on writing and progressively gives up on drawing. In 2000 he launches the hugely successful Le Triangle Secret series.
name: Didier Convard

deck: Marie Aumont is a letterer working in Franco-Belgian comics.
description: Marie Aumont is a graduate of the Royal Academy of Fine Arts of The Hague and the Parisian ESAIG. She is a graphic designer, typoraphical creation specialist, journalist, professor and artistic director for exhibitions, magazines and websites.

deck: Stephanie Vozzo (now Cofell) is a freelance colorist. She has worked for Archie Comics for more than 20 years, and worked on Scarlett at DC Comics.
description: Stephanie specializes in coloring with brush and watercolor paints, the old-fashioned way, using Dr. Ph Martin Synchromatic Watercolors. If a page is particularly "busy," she says it could take an hour to complete it.
name: Stephanie Vozzo

description: Creator of Skippy.

deck: Chantal De Spiegeleer is a Belgian comic book writer, illustrator and colorist.
description: Chantal De Spiegeleer was born in the Belgian Congo on April 14 1957. In 1975 she studies art at the Institut Saint-Luc in Brussels. She starts her comic book career in 1982 and is quickly noticed by Le Journal De Tintin. She takes a break from the industry in the mid-nineties to work on video games, virtual painting and fabric creation. She now lives in the Grenadines, in the Caribbean, where she survives her late husband RenÃ© Sterne.
name: Chantal De Spiegeleer

deck: Laurence Croix is a French colorist.
description: Laurence Croix was born in France on January 29 1974. She studied art in university.
name: Laurence Croix

deck: Antoine Aubin is a French comic book illustrator.
description: Antoine Aubin was born in Normandy, France on August 8 1967 as Antoine FrÃ©chon. After illustrating in magazines for a few years, he releases a first comic in 2004, written by Wazem.
name: Antoine Aubin

deck: Ãtienne SchrÃ©der is a Belgian musician, comic book writer and artist
description: Ãtienne SchrÃ©der was born in Belgium in 1950. After law and criminology studies he works in two successive penitentiaries before taking an extended break from everything. Nearing forty and remembering his attraction to comic books, he enrolls in night classes for five years and with success profiling itself, he quits his managing job in 1989 to concentrate on his new trade. His first full-length creation comes out in 1991. Additionally, he storyboards for films and video games.
name: Ãtienne SchrÃ©der
